txt.en: 'Very good, [placeholder]! This mint smells very fresh and should cover the foul taste of the toad.\n\n'Do me a favour and grind it on that grinding stone, will you?'
'You have not brought me the mint for which I asked, [placeholder].'
Collected slimy crawler mandibles ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Best Served Cold

'The smell is improved some....'

Indor tastes the stew and grimaces.

'But alas, the stew tastes like freshly-turned earth. What can be done...?'
'Hello, [placeholder]. What can I help you with?'
'Where's the crawler mush, [placeholder]?'
Collected mint ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'There are crawlers all over Tâl Bruinen, [placeholder], but they especially like damp places. Bring me some of their bristly legs and slimy mandibles and we will teach that Wéthorm a lesson!'

'Hello, [placeholder]. Wéthorm at your service and your family's! Ah, you are a friend of Indor! He is a good Man, if a little too trusting in these dangerous times. He would do well to learn that lesson early.'\n\nWéthorm takes a tremendous bite of the toad stew, and his face lights up. He takes a second bite, and then a third, before handing the bowl back to you.
Collected slimy crawler mandibles ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'The grinding stone is right there, [placeholder]. Grind all the crawler pieces into mush, and then I can add them to the stew! We will teach Wéthorm to play tricks on us!'
'Hello, [placeholder]. What can I help you with?'
You grind the crawler bits into mush

Crawlers can be found all throughout Tâl Bruinen.\n\nIndor has asked you to collect several pieces from the crawlers of Tâl Bruinen so he can have his revenge upon the dwarf who played a trick on him.

'Wéthorm is staying at Thorenhad, north of here in the Bruinen Gorges of the Trollshaws, north of the bear-dens. Pay close attention to his first bite of my toad stew, because I want to savour my revenge!'

Indor is at the campfire at Echad Candelleth, in Tâl Bruinen, south-east of the fields where you collected the mint.\n\nYou have collected the mint for which Indor asked and should now bring it to him, so he can add it to the stew he is preparing.

'That Wéthorm has been having a bit of fun at my expense, if you ask me! Well, we will have some sport as well and see how he likes it!

'I will need your help, [placeholder]. I am going to \qimprove\q the toad stew by adding crawler bits to it, and then I will have you bring it to Wéthorm. Tell him that I made some improvements to the stew, and it is even better now! Oh, we will have the last laugh with this one, my dear [placeholder]!

'Gather some crawler legs and mandibles and bring them back to me, and we will set my plan in motion! You will find crawlers all throughout Tâl Bruinen, [placeholder], so start hunting!'
The grinding stone is near the camp-fire at Echad Candelleth.\n\nIndor has asked you to grind the various crawler bits you recovered into mush on a nearby grinding stone.
Indor is at the campfire at Echad Candelleth, in Tâl Bruinen.\n\nYou have crushed the mint you gathered into a paste and should bring it to Indor so he can add it to the stew.

Wéthorm is at Thorenhad, in the Bruinen Gorges of the Trollshaws, north of the bear-dens.\n\nIndor has sent you to Wéthorm with his toad stew, and has asked you to pay close attention to the dwarf's reaction to his first bite. Indor wishes to savour his revenge on the dwarf who tricked him into tasting the unpleasant toad stew.
'There are crawlers all over Tâl Bruinen, [placeholder], but they especially like damp places. Bring me some of their bristly legs and slimy mandibles and we will teach that Wéthorm a lesson!'
'Very good, [placeholder]! These legs and mandibles are very unappealing and will be just the thing!\n\n'Do me a favour and grind them into mush on that grinding stone, will you?'
'The grinding stone is right there, [placeholder]. Grind all the crawler pieces into mush, and then I can add them to the stew! We will teach Wéthorm to play tricks on us!'

Indor is at the camp-fire at Echad Candelleth, in Tâl Bruinen.\n\nYou have collected the crawler bits for which Indor asked and should now bring them to him, so he can add them to the stew he is preparing.

'This will do nicely, [placeholder]. It looks terrible, and it smells worse! It is perfect!

'Now, take this toad stew and bring it to the Dwarf Wéthorm at Thorenhad. Tell him that I made some additions to the stew to make it taste even better, and I wanted to share it with him. And be sure to get a good look at his face when he takes a bite -- I want you to describe it to me, leaving nothing out! We will have the last laugh, we will!

'Thorenhad is north of here, in the Trollshaws, along the Bruinen Gorges. Wéthorm said he was going to visit one of his kinsmen there for a while, and I am sure he is still there.'
Indor has decided to reciprocate Wéthorm's bad humour with an ill joke of his own.

'Hello, [placeholder]. Wéthorm at your service and your family's! Ah, you are a friend of Indor! He is a good Man, if a little too trusting in these dangerous times. He would do well to learn that lesson early.'\n\nWéthorm takes a tremendous bite of the toad stew, and his face lights up. He takes a second bite, and then a third, before handing the bowl back to you.
Indor is at the camp-fire at Echad Candelleth, in Tâl Bruinen.\n\nYou have ground the crawler pieces you collected into mush and should now bring the mush to Indor so he can add it to the stew.
Collect mint ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collect slimy crawler mandibles ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

Wéthorm is at Thorenhad, in the Bruinen Gorges of the Trollshaws, north of the bear-dens.\n\nIndor has sent you to Wéthorm with his toad stew, and has asked you to pay close attention to the dwarf's reaction to his first bite. Indor wishes to savour his revenge on the dwarf who tricked him into tasting the unpleasant toad stew.
Bring crawler legs and mandibles to Indor
Grind crawler bits into mush on the grinding stone
Bring the crawler mush to Indor
Bring improved toad stew to Wéthorm
Collect mint ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collect bristly crawler legs ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Indor was not at all pleased with the taste of his toad-stew, but believes that he can save it with some seasonings.
Collect slimy crawler mandibles ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Bring improved toad stew to Wéthorm
Collected mint ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Wéthorm is staying at Thorenhad, north of here in the Bruinen Gorges of the Trollshaws, north of the bear-dens. Pay close attention to his first bite of my toad stew, because I want to savour my revenge!'
'You have not brought me all the pieces of crawler for which I asked, [placeholder].'

'It matters not the skill of a cook if the ingredients are of such poor quality. However, I believe I can save this dish with a bit of seasoning.\n\n'I believe a touch of mint would help...you can find mint growing in the grassy places to the north-west. If you would bring me some, I would appreciate it.'
Collected bristly crawler legs ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
